fields.summary: unable to attach volume to stopped instance, but success is reported

fields.description: From the volume landing/detail pages, the attach volume dialogs only list the running instances. However, when tried from the stopped instance on AWS, it is a valid operation that a volume can be attached to a stopped instance.
fields.summary: From the volume page, volumes cannot be attached to stopped instances

comments.body: [~kyolee]: Does Eucalyptus allow a volume to be attached to a stopped instance?

[~kgill], [~dkavanagh]: I'm able to select the stopped instance now to attach the volume to.  However, the attachment doesn't appear to work.  The UI on the volume launch page never changes from 'Available' to 'Attached'.  I also cannot see the volume if I start the instance and ssh into the it.  I am able to attach and see the volume when the instance is already running.  

I see this from the logs during the failure:
{code}
eucaconsole.log:
2014-06-30 16:25:51 INFO eucalyptus/admin [qchNORA0uwm9K2Yu]: Attaching volume vol-effa24b3 to i-c7e0ceb5 as /dev/sdf

This does seem to be a back-end issue. Here is what we see on the console side:
